facts.text: In 2006, the San Jose Earthquakes' team and operations were moved to Houston, where the team was initially named Houston 1836 before being renamed the Houston Dynamo.
The San Jose Earthquakes were officially put on hiatus after the 2005 season when their owner, Anschutz Entertainment Group, moved the team to Houston.
Major League Soccer (MLS) considers the Houston Dynamo as an expansion team, similar to the NFL's treatment of the Baltimore Ravens.
On July 18, 2007, an expansion team under the Earthquakes name was awarded to Lewis Wolff and John Fisher, retaining the records, logos, colors, and titles of the 1996–2005 franchise.

Frank Yallop returned as head coach of the San Jose Earthquakes in November 2007, with the team compensating his previous employer, the Los Angeles Galaxy, with a third-round pick in the 2008 MLS SuperDraft.
Darren Huckerby won the MLS Newcomer of the Year in 2008 while playing for the San Jose Earthquakes.
The San Jose Earthquakes signed a partnership agreement with English Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur in October 2008.
Amway Global became the official jersey sponsor of the San Jose Earthquakes on January 27, 2009, in a three-year deal.
Chris Wondolowski was acquired by the San Jose Earthquakes from Houston on June 9, 2009.
The San Jose Earthquakes qualified for the playoffs in 2010 as the West's No. 6 seed with 46 points and upset the No. 1 seeded New York Red Bulls in the MLS playoffs by winning the aggregate 3-2.
Chris Wondolowski scored the equalizing goal in Leitch's first MLS match as head coach in a 2-1 win over the LA Galaxy on July 1.
Tommy Thompson scored his first league goal on July 4 in a match against Atlanta United FC.
On July 4, Chris Wondolowski broke Ramiro Corrales' record for career starts at San Jose with his 229th start.
The Earthquakes announced a multi-year collaboration with the German Football Association focused on knowledge exchange and game development on July 7, 2017.
The Earthquakes advanced to the semifinals of the U.S. Open Cup for the first time since 2004 after defeating the Galaxy 3-2 on July 10, 2017.
Chris Wondolowski wore the number 38 in a match on July 10, 2017, in honor of teammate Matheus Silva.
Vako made his MLS debut and scored against the New York Red Bulls at Red Bull Arena on July 19.
The Earthquakes partnered with Second Spectrum, Inc. on July 21, 2017, to implement artificial intelligence and machine learning at Avaya Stadium.
San Jose lost in the Open Cup semifinals to Sporting Kansas City in sudden death penalties on August 9.
Chris Wondolowski became the first player in MLS history to score ten or more goals in eight consecutive seasons on August 19.
San Jose qualified for the 2017 MLS Cup Playoffs, their first playoff appearance since 2012, following a 3-2 win over Minnesota United FC on October 22.
San Jose was defeated 5-0 by Vancouver Whitecaps FC in a knockout round match of the 2017 MLS Cup Playoffs on October 25.
Mikael Stahre was announced as the new head coach of San Jose Earthquakes on November 24, 2017.
David Bingham's MLS rights were traded to Los Angeles Galaxy on December 18, 2017.
Joel Qwiberg was signed by San Jose Earthquakes from IF Brommapojkarna on December 1, 2017.
Jacob Akanyirige became San Jose Earthquakes' youngest ever player at fifteen years old when he was signed from their academy.
Magnus Eriksson joined San Jose Earthquakes on December 20, 2017, from Djurgårdens IF where he was the co-top scorer of Allsvenskan in the 2017 season.
Mikael Stahre was dismissed by San Jose Earthquakes before the end of his first year in charge.
Matias Almeyda was hired by San Jose Earthquakes on October 8, 2018, after being named the reigning CONCACAF coach of the year.
Chris Wondolowski set the MLS all-time scoring record on May 18, 2019, with his second goal against Chicago Fire.
The Earthquakes were drawn into Group B for the MLS is Back tournament in 2020 and advanced to the round of 16 after winning the group.
Chris Leitch was named as the new General Manager of San Jose Earthquakes on November 8, 2021.
Matias Almeyda and the San Jose Earthquakes agreed to part ways on April 18, 2022, with Alex Covelo stepping in as his interim replacement.
Luchi Gonzalez was announced as the coach of the Earthquakes on August 17, 2022.
Under Luchi Gonzalez's coaching, the Earthquakes qualified for the Wild Card round of the playoffs during the 2023 season, their first playoff match in 3 years.
Luchi Gonzalez was fired as the coach of the Earthquakes on June 24, 2024, after a poor string of results.
The Earthquakes finished last in the MLS during the 2024 season, setting a league record for the most last-place finishes in franchise history.
Bruce Arena was announced as the new head coach and sporting director of the Earthquakes on November 7, 2024.
The Earthquakes rebranded to their current name and introduced a new team badge in 2000.
The Earthquakes underwent another rebranding on January 30, 2014, introducing a new crest and uniform that featured the year 1974 in red.
On February 17, 2017, the Earthquakes released a new home kit that included references to the team's NASL history and the historic 2012 season.
The Earthquakes became the first club in MLS history to donate part of its jersey revenue to a nonprofit organization with the release of the Navy SEAL Foundation Jersey on February 11, 2018.
The Earthquakes' 2020–2021 away jersey incorporated the colors of the flag of San Jose (blue, white, yellow).
D.C. United won the MLS Cup four consecutive times from 1996 to 1999.
LA Galaxy won the MLS Cup in 2014 and 2024.
The Supporter's Shield was won by Los Angeles FC in both 2019 and 2022.
FC Cincinnati won the Supporter's Shield in 2023.
PayPal Park has been the home location for soccer in San Jose, California, from 2015 to the present.
Levi's Stadium served as a marquee venue for soccer in Santa Clara, California, from 2014 to 2015 and again in 2023 to 2024.
The kit manufacturer for the team from 1996 to 1999 was Nike, with Honda as the shirt sponsor.
From 2021 to 2024, PayPal served as the shirt sponsor for the team.
Josef Martínez, a forward from Venezuela, wears the number 17 jersey.
Chris Wondolowski holds the record for the most games played for the San Jose Earthquakes with 367 appearances.
Chris Wondolowski scored the most goals in a single season for the San Jose Earthquakes with 27 goals in 2012.
Eddie Lewis and Cristian Espinoza share the record for the most assists in a single season for the San Jose Earthquakes, each with 14 assists in 1997 and 2022, respectively.
Chris Wondolowski served as the captain of the San Jose Earthquakes from 2014 to 2021.
Bruce Arena became the head coach of the San Jose Earthquakes in November 2024.
Chris Leitch has been serving as the general manager of the San Jose Earthquakes since 2021.
Frank Yallop had two separate tenures as head coach of the San Jose Earthquakes, first from February 3, 2001, to December 12, 2003, and then from November 9, 2007, to June 7, 2013.
Dominic Kinnear also had two separate tenures as head coach of the San Jose Earthquakes, first from January 6, 2004, to December 15, 2005, and then from October 16, 2014, to June 25, 2017.
Matías Almeyda, from Argentina, served as the head coach of the San Jose Earthquakes from October 29, 2018, to April 18, 2022.
